channel.title: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?
channel.description:
I reallly fucked things up in my Ubuntu. I even asked on ubuntuforums.org and nobody could figure out my problem.
I installed wine, winetools, and easy ubuntu. Sadly, I didn't know how to uninstall, and since they didn't give any uninstallation instructions, I just removed the files and folders.
This caused some problems... None of my applications can connect to the internet except for Firefox.
When I do updates in the terminal, or search for updates, or even reload in the Synaptic Packet Manager, I get errors. Could anyone help? And no it's not telnet. When I disabled that, and rebooted, everything was fine. So not telnet. :P
Please help. Thank you.

item.title: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @p_a_r_t_y_b_o_y p a r t y b o y
item.description:
@p_a_r_t_y_b_o_y wrote:

GO TO THEM AND CLICK DELETE BUTTON

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

Ron:

Should I replace package and Installed-Size with the name of the package and the total installed size?

no, leave those as is

item.source: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?

item.title: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

type this into the terminal : dpkg-query -W --showformat=’${Installed-Size} ${Package}\n’ | sort -n | grep winetools

then when thats done, type this: apt-get remove --purge partone parttwo etc…
while replacing partone and parttwo with the files that were listed above when you did the first command.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?

item.title: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I used apt-get to install them. I already found them in the synaptic packet manager and that’s how I got rid of wine.

I can’t get rid of winetools though. And I know winetools is still on my computer, becasue when i enter

wt

into the terminal, it says winetools could not be found. Those applications installed themselves not in the filesystem or the desktop. They installed themselves in the ron directory.

I think maybe I should just reinstall it lol. I screwed around with it too much.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?

item.title: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @ghostboy195 ghostboy195
item.description:
@ghostboy195 wrote:

you probably shouldn’t of just deleted the folders. ok, how did you install them? apt-get? aptitude? downloading them?

item.title: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @Gorlackgoo Gorlackgoo
item.description:
@Gorlackgoo wrote:

It’s a good thing because he can now uninstall Shibuntu and perhaps install something better.
For fuck sake, use the inbuilt package manager and use CTRL + F. If you can’t use it, then you should be shot.

item.title: How do I uninstall programs in Ubuntu?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

Gorlackgoo:

That’s a good thng

Dumbass.

Did the programs install in their own folder, or did they just install into an existing folder? If they installed to an existing folder, then was it a system folder?
